title: Lynda - Music Law: Copyrighting a Song
description:
Lynda - Music Law: Copyrighting a Song

Subject:    Audio + Music 
Author:    Richard Stim 

1h 7m Appropriate for all Mar 13, 2015 |  Uploaded in Apr 26, 2015 by 2boweb

Copyrighting a song is not the easiest process, but it's vital for songwriters. It preserves your legal claims to songs and your ability to monetize them. In this course, Rich Stim provides essential guidance to navigate the process and understand the main language, concepts, and business aspects of music copyright.

Rich starts by defining what a song copyright and a sound recording copyright areÃ¢â‚¬â€and how they're different. He defines who owns a song, and how to sort out contributions from multiple writers of the same song. Then he explains how to get a copyright using the U.S. Copyright Office's online application process. The course wraps up by discussing possible objections that copyright examiners may have, as well as what to do to maintain your copyright and correct any errors that crop up.

Topics include:

    What is a song copyright?
    Who owns a song?
    Evaluating cowriters and their contributions
    Registering a song copyright
    Maintaining a copyright registration
